description: Contraceptive Method Choice dataset from the 1987 National Indonesia Contraceptive Prevalence Survey. Predicts contraceptive method choice of married women based on demographic and socio-economic characteristics.
creator: Tjen-Sien Lim (University of Wisconsin)
use_case: Family planning programs, healthcare policy development, understanding contraceptive adoption patterns, demographic studies
dataset_characteristics: Survey data from married women who were either not pregnant or did not know if they were at the time of interview
data_collection: Data collected as part of the 1987 National Indonesia Contraceptive Prevalence Survey
challenges: Class imbalance, cultural and religious factors affecting contraceptive choices, limited geographic scope (Indonesia only)
ethical_considerations: Sensitive personal health information, cultural and religious considerations, gender-specific data, potential for reinforcing stereotypes

citations.author: Tjen-Sien Lim, Wei-Yin Loh, Yu-Shan Shih
citations.title: A Comparison of Prediction Accuracy, Complexity, and Training Time of Thirty-three Old and New Classification Algorithms

original_source.creator: Tjen-Sien Lim (University of Wisconsin)
original_source.publication: Tjen-Sien Lim, Wei-Yin Loh, Yu-Shan Shih: A Comparison of Prediction Accuracy, Complexity, and Training Time of Thirty-three Old and New Classification Algorithms

dataset_history: Data Collection: Data collected as part of the 1987 National Indonesia Contraceptive Prevalence Survey
inference_notes: Challenges: Class imbalance, cultural and religious factors affecting contraceptive choices, limited geographic scope (Indonesia only). Use Case: Family planning programs, healthcare policy development, understanding contraceptive adoption patterns, demographic studies
